physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient appeared conscious and cooperative but showed signs of physiological distress.
Weakness in eye closure, loss of nasolabial folds, and an inability to smile.

Signs suggestive of cerebellar impairment, including dysdiadochokinesia, impaired finger-nose test, impaired heel-shin, and tandem walking, but no dysarthria. Also showed signs of vestibulocochlear nerve impairment.
